item.title: The Relative Motion of the Earth and the Aether
item.description: To explain the aberration of light, Fresnel assumed that the aether does not share the annual motion of earth. This requires the Earth to be completely permeable to the aether. Later, Stokes explained that the aether is dragged by the earth. This made the speed of the aether the same as that of the earth at each point at the earth’s surface. I have extensively worked on these theories. [1].
